snippet.title: 'BioShock Infinite: Burial At Sea' Release Date Announced
snippet.description: The 'Burial At Sea' DLC for 2K's 'BioShock Infinite' is coming this November.

snippet.title: 'Dragon Age: Inquisition' Box-Art Is 'Gender-Neutral'
snippet.description: The newly released box-art for 'Dragon Age: Inquisition' is intentionally vague. read »

snippet.title: BioShock Infinite Review - Xbox 360 Version
snippet.description: BioShock Infinite, the "spiritual sequel" to 2007's highly-praised BioShock, itself the spiritual sequel to the highly-praised System Shock 2, has expectations as sky-high as its cloud-city setting. Can it deliver? read »

snippet.title: Bioshock Infinite Delayed Yet Again
snippet.description: It's almost a running joke at this point how many times Bioshock Infinite has been delayed at this point, so it's no surprise to be writing another story like this one. That said, I've never been of the school of thought that delaying a game is necessarily a bad thing. [...] read »

snippet.title: The Shock Doctrine - BioShock Infinite (Spoiler-free) Review
snippet.description: At the dying of the light for the current gaming hardware cycle, Take-Two Interactive are finishing strongly: Grand Theft Auto 5 will be one of the biggest-selling games of 2013. But will BioShock Infinite be remembered as the best? read »

snippet.title: Irrational Decisions: Ken Levine Talks BioShock, Burial At Sea And The Future Of Storytelling
snippet.description: Ken Levine, cofounder and Creative Director of Irrational Games, talks to Forbes about BioShock Infinite, his greatest regret as a game designer, and how football (American or everywhere-else version) relates to the behavior of Elizabeth, the heroine of 'Burial at Sea'. read »

snippet.title: BioShock Infinite Preview - Oh, Amber Waves of Pain
snippet.description: BioShock Infinite's gown continues to slip - I spent some time in Columbia with producer Mike Soden. read »

snippet.title: Bioshock: Infinite Delayed Until 2013
snippet.description: Bioshock Infinite was going to be one of the most anticipated releases of the holiday season, but now it looks like it’s going to be one of the most anticipated releases of early 2013. Irrational Games’ talked-about follow-up to Bioshock (which I had some problems with) sends the hero to the [...] read »

snippet.title: In Retrospect: 'Gone Home' Designer On 'BioShock', 'Bastion' And The Indie Games Business
snippet.description: Although The Fullbright Company's Gone Home was something of an indie darling well before its release, the four-person studio is still reeling a little, it seems, from the commercial and critical reception it received at launch last week. In this interview, conducted earlier this year, founder and designer Steve Gaynor discussed the emotional and [...] read »

snippet.title: BioShock Infinite's Sky-Hook Is 'Guaranteed to Put the Steam in Your Punk'
snippet.description: How do you get from point A to point B in a city in the clouds? If you’re a citizen of Columbia, the floating city in the upcoming game BioShock Infinite, you use a Sky-Hook to transport you across Sky-Lines. And how do you attack enemies? A Sky-Hook, of course. Wait, it’s a method of transportation and a weapon? I need it. read »
